title: Define Project Scope and Requirements - Reworked
description: Provide a comprehensive outline of the project's scope, objectives, and technical requirements. This encompasses detailing the types of literary works to be analyzed (e.g., novels, short stories, plays, poetry, speeches), the preferred output format (structured data, visualizations, or both), the desired level of accuracy and detail, specific features such as genre classification, author identification, theme analysis, character analysis, sentiment analysis, plot structure detection, and any other necessary functionalities. Also, specify the user interface requirements (mobile and web versions, multiple language support), API endpoints, database schema (including data normalization and indexing strategies), security considerations (data privacy, authentication, and authorization mechanisms), testing procedures, performance benchmarks, scalability plans, disaster recovery strategies, and error handling strategies. Include a discussion on the machine learning algorithms to be used for text analysis and natural language processing. Furthermore, define the interface for user input and interaction, such as uploading files or copy-pasting text. Also, consider the accessibility of the application for users with different abilities. Lastly, update the task status to 'APPROVED FOR NEXT STATE' when the review is complete.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including the data pipeline, processing components, and user interface.

title: Develop Data Ingestion and Preprocessing
description: Implement components for ingesting and preprocessing literary works, including text extraction, cleaning, and normalization.

title: Implement Genre and Author Identification
description: Develop machine learning models and algorithms for identifying core elements, stylistic markers, and narrative structures that define different genres and authors.

title: Build User Interface
description: Design and implement the user interface for interacting with the system, including input and output visualization.

title: Integrate System Components
description: Integrate the data ingestion, preprocessing, genre/author identification, and user interface components into a cohesive system.

title: Develop Comprehensive Testing Strategy
description: Develop a robust testing strategy that encompasses unit tests, integration tests, end-to-end tests, and performance tests for the AI model. The strategy should consider a wide range of genres, authors, edge cases, accuracy, reliability, and robustness of the system. To ensure effective testing, include test cases for uncommon genres, diverse author styles, and outlier data. Implement regression testing to maintain system performance post-implementation. Focus on corner cases in genres where our model may not have significant data for training. Detailed documentation should be provided for each test case, the expected outcome, and any known issues or limitations. The metrics for evaluating test success and failure should be clearly defined. As the model development progresses and more data becomes available, update the strategy accordingly. To facilitate clear communication, write detailed documentation and make it accessible to all team members.

title: Conduct Security Audit
description: Perform a security audit to identify and mitigate potential vulnerabilities in the system.

title: Deploy and Monitor System
description: Deploy the system to a production environment and implement monitoring and logging mechanisms.

title: Create Documentation
description: Develop comprehensive documentation, including user guides, API references, and system architecture diagrams.
